submapp.hmm.Hmm¶

class submapp.hmm.Hmm(n_obs: int, n_dis: int, name: str = 'MyHMM')¶

Hidden Markov Model

Variables

name (str) – The Name of the Hmm object. This name has no impact on the variable name, however it can be usefull when it comes to saving the Hmm object and its related figures, defaults to “MyHmm”

Attributes¶

Hmm.Em

Emission matrix

Hmm.Tr

Transition matrix

Hmm.ln_Em_eps

Pseudo-counts associated to the Emission matrix

Hmm.ln_Tr_eps

Pseudo-counts associated to the Transition matrix

Hmm.ln_pi_eps

Pseudo-counts associated to the Initialization matrix

Hmm.model

Model (Tr, Em, pi) of the HMM

Hmm.n_dis

Total number of hidden classes

Hmm.n_obs

Total number of observable classes

Hmm.pi

Initialization matrix

Methods¶

Hmm.__init__

Class constructor

Hmm.bw

Apply Baum-Welch algorithm to the Hmm

Hmm.init_model

Initializes the model (Tr, Em, pi) and pseudo-counts

Hmm.neighborhood

“Propagate” the probability of a hidden class to its neighbours

Hmm.smooth_transitions

Penalize (i.e decrease probability) long distance transitions

Hmm.viterbi

Viterbi algorithm: retrieve hidden data from observable data
